Krishna.Role: Supreme Being, Preserver, Teacher of Dharma

Mahabharata.Description: Central figure, charioteer to Arjuna, delivers Bhagavad Gita

BhagavadGita.Description: Sacred dialogue between Krishna and Arjuna

SrimadBhagavatam.Description: Narrates Krishna's life, miracles, and divine play (Leela)

PhilosophicalSignificance: Symbol of divine love and cosmic order
Teacher of selfless action and devotion

Mantras.Name: Krishna Maha Mantra
Mantras.Text: हरे कृष्ण हरे कृष्ण कृष्ण कृष्ण हरे हरे। हरे राम हरे राम राम राम हरे हरे॥
Mantras.Transliteration: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna Hare Hare; Hare Rama Hare Rama, Rama Rama Hare Hare
Mantras.Meaning: Chant invoking Krishna and Rama for liberation and divine love.

Mantras.Name: Krishna Beej Mantra
Mantras.Meaning: Salutation to Krishna, the all-attractive one.

Mantras.Name: Gita Invocation
Mantras.Meaning: Homage to Lord Krishna, the teacher of the Gita.

Ashtabhava.Description: Eight principal forms or moods of Krishna representing different divine aspects

Forms.Name: Vasudeva
Forms.Details: Represents Krishna as the ultimate reality and source of all creation. Worshipped as the universal protector and preserver.

Forms.Name: Sankarsana
Forms.Details: Symbolizes spiritual strength and the power to uphold dharma. Associated with the principle of ego dissolution.

Forms.Name: Pradyumna
Forms.Details: Embodies divine love and attraction. Represents the creative energy that sustains life and relationships.

Forms.Name: Aniruddha
Forms.Details: Personifies wisdom, clarity, and mental discipline. Guides devotees toward self-realization and higher consciousness.

Forms.Name: Govinda
Forms.Details: Highlights Krishna’s role as a nurturer of life and ecology. Associated with pastoral beauty and harmony with nature.

Forms.Name: Gopala
Forms.Details: Represents Krishna’s playful and loving nature as a cowherd boy. Symbol of joy, simplicity, and divine play (Leela).

Forms.Name: Madhava
Forms.Details: Signifies abundance, auspiciousness, and divine grace. Often invoked for blessings of wealth and happiness.

Forms.Name: Keshava
Forms.Aspect: Destroyer of evil, preserver of good
Forms.Details: Represents Krishna as the protector who annihilates negativity and restores cosmic balance.
